text:
Aroma e bogată, intensă, plăcută și dulce; un mix foarte reușit de multă caramelă, flori, fructe (caise/piersici) caramelizate, dulceață de fructe concentrată cu puțin alcool; totul pare un desert exotic/oriental foarte dulce.
Gustul e cumva mai redus din intensitate și concentrație, cu aceleași flori, caramelă, fructe caramelizate și dulceață din aceste fructe, adăugînd ceva amăreală, totul ușor și fin diluat cu alcool și căldură plăcută de alcool.
E foarte bună, plăcută, bogată și interesantă, ideală pentru a fi servită singură, lent și nimic altceva.

Blind tasting with Dr. Beer, served in black glassware. Smell is bit of esthers ( mild ) bit of overripe fruits. Some biscuit malts, some alcohol notes as well. Mild peppery notes. 
Taste is full, mild bitter, creamy, some yeast flavors, bready / biscuity malts, some very minor caramel. Medium MF, OK carbo.
Пробова& на дегуста& крепост& все-таки выпирае& не очень мне.

50 cl bottle served in Fullers shaker at Mad Bishop and Bear, Paddington station concourse. Pours clean dark copper orange to ruby red, tan long-lasting head (quite unusual for an English ale). Aroma is intense: rip banana, red berries, clove, cinnamon. Mouth is powerful, wide, sweetnsour. Fast it goes down the throat, even though it lasts quite long afterwards. Nice, though somewhat cloying.

(500 ml bottle) Pours a clear deep ruby-mahogany beer, with fine steady carbonation, and a creamy off-white head. The aroma is malty, and full of fruit, with a delicate touch of English hops. Notes include: toffee, caramel, biscuit, spices, raisins, overripe plum, apricot kernel, elder flower, mineral water and oak. It tastes bittersweet, with a silky-smooth mouthfeel. On the palate, the beer develops vinous qualities, and is reminiscent of brandy. Considering the sheer quality of beer, and idiom in which it is brewed, this is a great example of English Strong Ale. Its beautifully blended, and you simply wouldnt think this is an 8.5% beer.
Klares Kupferrot mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, etwas Honig, Karamell, Nüsse, leicht fruchtig, Waldbeeren, sehr süffig.

330ml Bottle: Pours a slightly hazy amber with thin off-white head. Aromas of caramel and stone fruit. Beer finishes sweet with caramel notes. Not overly bitter with slight alcohol warmth. Full bodied, medium to low carbonation. Overall the beer has nice flavours that would go well with a hearty meal.
bottle. head needs more duration. med-full bodied. spicy character. bittersweet finish.

I can understand why this has the word "pride" in the name as there are, to me, definite echoes of London Pride in this beer. A rich golden, hoppy and quite malty beer with a strong flavour of alcohol. Its in no way sessionable and although it is nice to try I will not be revisiting.

Bottle at home. Pours light brown with pleasent white head, which dissipates rather quickly. Tastes like light caramel, toffee, slight wooden barrel taste with nice astringency. Medium carbonation. Very good english ale.
Draft at the Parcel Yard. Amber colour. Toffee and caramel notes. Very mild hop tasting.

Pours with a good dense, guinness-like, white foam. Color is very pretty clear, bright dark copper. Aroma has typical strong ale flavours such as a general maltiness and "mango chutney" like aroma. Additionally some port wine, honey, caramel and sweet malts. The aroma is very fine and "luxurious". Palate is pretty nice. Theres oiliness, but its not overwhelming, but balanced. Taste has sweet malt and surely its "strong ale". Additionally some (slightly burnt) caramel and cognac like aromas. Its tasty and the 8.5% alc vol gives it a solid body thats not weak. Its one of the best ales Ive had and this is actually an ale that I find pleasing (I usually dont like ales that much).

330ml bottle. Deep red colour with minimal off white head. Fruity aroma with a touch of caramel malt. Medium-high sweetness, low bitterness. Full bodied, fairly sticky texture, smooth finish. Alcohol is quite present, but doesnt bludgeon you. Not tasting this in winter, but it has the feel of a winter warmer. A very satisfying brew.

Data ważności: sierpień 2015. Barwa burgundowa, piana niska, szybko zanikająca. Aromat bardzo intensywny, chlebowy, słodowy, ale jakiś taki szlachetny. Także nieco suszonych owoców. W smaku również bardzo wyraźne nuty słodowe, skórka od chleba, pumpernikiel, słody prażone. Goryczka średnia, Bardzo dobre.

Bottle, 0.50l. Clear mahogany color with thin soapy tan-like head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of caramel, dark fruit, cognac, resin and herbs. Taste starts with medium sweet caramel and toasted malt, follows by grass, dark fruit and wood, mouthfeel is mild spicy and warming, while finish is medium bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Mahogany pride...
Erőteljes pörkölt malátás, karamelles illat. Erős, testes sör. Nem egy könnyed darab.

Cerveja âmbar escura, com aroma bem complexo de malte, caramelo, toffee, frutas secas (ameixa e figo), casca de laranja, madeira, especiarias e uma boa pancadinha de álcool. Sabor doce, mas não enjoativo, também complexo, com frutas e malte tomando conta, quase sem amargor. Picância do álcool presente, bem agradável e leve amargor final. Ótimo corpo, baixíssima carbonatação, drinkabilidade média. Grande cerveja, cheia de sabor.

Bottle, 500 ml. Pours clear, deep amber/red with a finger off off-white head. Patchy lacing, small amount of carb visible. Aroma is powerfully malty and fruity; wholemeal/farmhouse bread, honey, blood orange cointreau, cognac, cinnamon and various other spices, touch of vanilla and some faintly resinous hops right in the back. Hardly any booze. Taste is sweet but not sickly; again very malty with some dark fruits now coming through in the front along with molasses and dark, maybe spiced rum. Hints of an alcoholic, medicinal, but by no means harsh bitterness develops towards the back and lingers a while on the tongue and sides of the mouth in the long, wet finish, alongside plenty more cereal and bread. Body is full, texture is thick and oily and avoids becoming sticky or cloying, and as expected theres no real carbonation aside from a slight tingle occasionally. Warming after a few sips! Really fantastically crafted strong English ale that develops smoothly and subtly instead of just blasting you with sticky, sickly malt and booze from the get-go. Exemplary stuff, dunno why Ive never had it before now!
Bottle. Deep amber with some lasting foam. Aroma is malt, caramel and bread. Taste is malts, nuts, fruits and caramel with a strong bitter ending. A bit alcohol is present as well.

Birra dal colore ambrato carico tendente al rubino. Aromi e profumi dominanti sono malto caramello biscotto e frutta sotto spirito. Retrogusto liquoroso, alcoolico e riscaldante. Corpo pieno e carbonazione bassa.

Bottle. Reddish Amber in colour. Very heavily malted; toasty malts, caramel, toffee, hint of chocolate. Fruity; citrus-orange, marmalade, peel. Hoppy; earthy and spicy hops. Intense strong flavours. Heavy alcohol hit. Full-bodied & syrupy. Sweet malty fruity strong ale. Dry malty lasting finish. English Strong Ale or Barley Wine?. Definitely a Classic; a Great Beer! (2016-02-08)
Bottle @ home. Clear copper pour with a frothy head. Notes of dark sweet malts, prunes, caramel, light roast and some grains.

- braune Farbe mit leichtem Rotstich
- leichte, schnell zerfallende Schaumbildung
- Aromen nach Röstmalz, braunem Zucker, Honig, Toffee, Marzipan, süßem Sherry, Trockenpflaumen, etwas Rum, Eiche und relativ viel Alkohol
- die Carbonisierung ist mir für diesen Typ etwas zu moussierend
- der Antrunk ist auf den ersten Schluck schon sehr zuckrig-süß
- erst danach entfalten sich die diversen Aromen angenehm nebeneinander
- leider ist mir aber der Alkohol durchgehend zu dominant schmeck- und riechbar
- die bittere Hopfennote versöhnt dann gegen Ende etwas
Fazit: Der Alkohol dominiert etwas zu sehr
500 ml bottle. Pours clear ruby with a very short-lived off-white head. Aroma of caramel, wood, slightly alcoholic, warm. Taste is mostly caramel, pepper. High carbonation. Nice beer.

This beer has a really strong oud wood aroma which you can also taste but it also has honey, rum, molases, oak, leather, and of course malt. I feel its a little unbalanced because that leathery notes are stronger than the others and the aftertastes is a little rough. Still a great beer. Maybe its because it has more alcohol. The body is strong like maple, really turbid. Really good beer.
Clear deep amber. Biscuit smell with lot of caramel flavour. Toasty bread notes with hint of nuts. yuuuup
user_location: The City of Craft beer, Oregon, USA

text: Добротн& очень красивы& эль, хороший аромат с нотками меда и луговых цветов и вкус и продолж& послевк& с горчинк& Алкогол& особо не ощущает& Дата розлива 07.04.2016. (Bottle 0,5/ 8,5%)

Bottle 0.5. Shared with friends.
Reddish brown color. Aroma: spicy, caramel. Taste: well balanced, bitter/sweet, caramel, toffee. Very nice.

Pours copper red with medium thick off-white head. Aroma is fruity, mandarin, tropical sweet fruits, grapes, sweet mango, some malts, flowers. Taste is quite same, sweet, tropical fruits, fruity sugar, raisins, berries, some floral, malts. Superb beer!

Aroma of alcohol mainly, then some caramel. Clear light amber color with a creamy white foam. Medium sweetness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation. Disappointing: the overwhelming ethyl feel ruins everything just like a cheap beer for alcoholics.

Nice dark amber colour with a think tan head. Some distant notes of orange coupled with roasted malt in the aroma. I think my bottle had some problem as I found also a strange smell, not a stink but weird.
Taste is sweet and malty, just a little of bitterness in the end. Alcohol is noticeable but not overwelming.
Not as rich and tasteful as expected honestly.

Ruby red. Head fell down immediatly (british). Smell of red malt and lots of alcohol. No complex aroma beside the taste of red malt and a bit caramel. Medium body. Way too big bottle to enjoy this (for me) boring beer. Maybe it tastes better the next time, but this time it just made me drunk within a short time.
500ml bottle from aPivo.ru. Pours amber/ruby with a small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hops. Taste is marzipan, toffee, malt, some warming alcohol.

Copenhagen 12/9 2016. 50 cl bottle from Føtex. Dark red label with considerate warnings like "Superior Strength Ale". It is only an ABV of 8,5 after all. Pours clear reddish amber with slightly off-white head. Settles as very thin layer of foam. Aroma is very sweet. Fermented, sugary plum, blackcurrant and prunes. Like sniffing your mamas port. Actually reminds me a bit of dessert wine. Soft carbonation and semi thick palate. Flavor is immensely sweet with almost no bitterness at all. It does not only smell like your mamas port - it actually also taste like your mothers port.

Vanilla caramel marshmallow cherry sweet booze aroma. Heavy big bodied beer. Slight bitterness, but mostly a sticky boozy caramel tasting brew not unlike a German doppelbock. Strong and intense. Some nutty malt, but then sticky syrupy malts after that. A bit much for me, I prefer the ESB, not just since its lighter, but it just tastes better to me. MJs comment likening this to a cognac is not far off, its a sipper, but not my favorite one from that category.
Bottle. Clear ruby color with tan head. Aroma - Fruity, violets, caramel. Taste - Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, blackberries, caramel, malt.

500ml bottle from Fullers online shop. Coppery amber colour, tan foam head and malty nose. Flavour is malt, sweet, molasses, some caramel, fruity orange, with bready and nutty bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry malty tangy bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.

Bottle - Clear light amber colour, medium and persistent off-white head. Sweet malty aromas with fruity notes. Taste is sweet malty with some cookies, bread and caramel, touch of honey, gentle herbal bitterness. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel, rich malty and fruity finish with some alcoholic tone. Great strong ale.
Deep copper with a white head that vanishes quickly. Taste is mainly malt and marmalade, some alcohol warmth, metallic finish... decent sipper but a bit uninspiring.

Deze English strong ale heeft een bijzonder aroma: vieux en boerenjongens. De alcohol komt ook goed door in de smaak en het mondgevoel. Verder proef je een heel lichte hint van mokka en perziken. Prima.

Kirkas punertavanoranssinruskea olut melko runsaalla vaalealla vaahdolla. Vaahto laskeutuu hetken päästä, mutta pinnalle jää edelleen pieni kerros. Samoin pitsiä jää lasin reunoille hieman. Tuoksu miedosti eksoottisen hedelmäinen sekä puumaisen havuinen. Ennen kaikkea tuoksua hallitsee toffeinen karamellisuus. Myös maku on vahvasti toffeisen karamellinen ja maltainen, aavistuksen hedelmäinen sekä puinen. Alkoholi tuntuu jälkipuolella hieman. Humalan aromit ovat aika täydellisesti piilossa. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen, hiilihappoja kevyesti. Hieman yksiulotteinen kokonaisuus.

500ml bottle. Clear dark ruby/amber colour with a small beige head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, dried fruit, light spice. Taste of rich sweet caramel malt, dried fruit, dark fruits like plum, toffee, a little alcohol, light spice/herbs. Very sweet initially, slight bitter finish though. Full bodied, soft carbonation, smooth oily-creamy mouthfeel, fairly boozy.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of toffee, lollipop, port and tropical fruits... the taste is caramel and fruity with notes of red wine, toffee, candy, sweet citrus and almond... sweet and dry aftertaste...

Bottle from the Brewery Online Shop. Pours clear red copper with a thin beige head. Aromas of red fruit, caramel, dried fruit and toast. Taste is light sweet, more dried mixed peel, good balance of light bitterness on the finish. Faintly herbal too. Some cedar. Lots to chew on.

Bottle. Pours a ruby, whisky-like colour, with faint lacing. Some plum, red grape, blackcurrent. Dark malts. Thats all well and good, but its really too boozy to work for me as a beer. Its nice as a taster, but I cant imagine drinking a whole bottle of this. Perhaps one to share after dinner (although perhaps youd want something even heavier!)

Deep amber, very clear, medium offwhite head, decent lacing. Aroma is rich with malt flavors: caramel, baguette crust, dried fruit, also some zest, resin and spice, paper/cardboard. Tastes sweetish, but has enough bitterness to keep it well rounded. A nice malty warmer, but I was expecting more. -1 for cardboard smell.
Markáns, közepesen telt ízű, fűszeres, gyümölcsös, nagyon enyhe keserűsség. Az utóíze sokáig megmarad.

Clear, reddish copper colour with a small tan head that quickly fades away. Sweet, malty aroma, syrup and caramel. Rich malty flavours with a slightly bitter, hoppy finish. Creamy and soft mouthfeel, very rich bodied with soft carbonation. Great ale with plenty of flavour, very enjoyable.

A deep amber coloured clear pour with a pretty thick, creamy foam that lasts a while. The nose is hoppy and sweet. The taste is malty, has nice balance of hops and sweetness. A little bit metallic taste, especially in the aftertaste.

Bottle 500 ml. Served chilled. Clear copper color. The foam is thick, whitish, stays for a long time. Wonderful aroma of baked bread, hay, sage. Bitterness is pretty strong immediately after the gulp but smoothly softens in a couple of seconds. Full bodied and rich. Very interesting experience.
bottle @ supermarket. goldenbrown colour, medium body, strong ale with caramel aroma

Bottle 500ml. Served at room temperature. Pours copper. Head is averaged sized, off-white and lasts well. Aroma is rich and amazingly complex with notes of amontillado sherry, burnt toffee, caramelized dates, dark cherries, dried apricots soaked in brandy, cedar and a pinch of Christmas spices. Flavour is smooth with a very light earthy bitterness; toasted malts, brandy, burnt brown sugar, figs, dried cranberries, glazed oranges and spiced cedar notes in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation, oily texture and a long warming finish. Incredible English Strong Ale! I true winter warmer in every sense!
This beer is great; fruit & caramel taste; light copper appearance; full body & sweet finish. It was disappeared from the Chilean market but fortunately is back. One of the best ale Ive drunk

Presenta ámbar oscuro con media corona de espuma beige formada por burbuja grande de aspecto jabonoso y de ligera retención en copa; aromas a caramelo, uvas pasas, miel, licor y ligero pan tostado; en boca entrada media, refrescante, maltosa con ligero amargor que torna a dulce en el retrogusto, el alcohol aunque alto está bien integrado, cuerpo y carbónico medios, cerveza potente, compleja y equilibrada hacia la malta, pero con el lúpulo presente en la fase de amargor.

Bottle @home. Pours slightly hazy amber with creamy white head. Medium body, average carbonation, fair lacing, slightly oily texture, bitter finish. Well balanced between hops and malts. Grainy, bread, caramel, dried fruits, notes of honey. Very satisfactory.

Bottle. Pours copper brown and clear with a small tan head. Fruity and spicy with some plum and sherry, light wodden note and a hint of pepper and light roasted and caramel malty notes in the back. Medium to thick body with a light sweet taste that turn into a nice dry finish. Good balance. Carbonation is medium and the alcohol is noticeable and causes some warmth. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy. Flavor is fruity and spicy as well, sherry and spices, pepper note grows stronger. Complex but familiar malty flavor. Leaves a a medium strong dry and light peppery aftertaste.

Bottle, pours copper dark-amber with a gorgeous white head that persist in a thin layer for a long time. Aroma of dried apricots, honey, caramel, some metal notes. Thick slightly oily body. Taste starts caramel sweet with some hints of toffee and morphs into a slightly metallic hop bitterness with hot alcohol flavors. A nice strong ale but would have been much greater if not for the evident alcohol in the aftertaste.

Look: clear copper with white creamy head.

Aroma: toffe, caramel, light spicy hoppy notes.
Taste: sweet with spicy hop bitterness.
Flavour: candied fruits, dried apricots, candies, some mature alcohol notes.
Aftertaste is more dry with some spicy bitterness and metal notes.

Very good.

Bottle at home. Clear dark amber-brown. Caramel and some bergamot tea with hints of black pepper in the nose, very alcoholic taste, a little sweet and somewhat oxidized. Round mouthfeel and full body with a long alcoholic finish.
Caramel, dried fruits, notes of alcohol, minimal white head, full body, soft carbonation, taste of toffee, some roasty notes....an amazing strong.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear amber with a small offwhite head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is malty and fruity with caramel, toffee, pears, soil, lemon peal and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and herbal. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny syrupy, astringent, slightly boozy and medium bodied. Finish is long, sweet, bitter, peppery boozy and metallic.

Deep amber to copper colour. Moderate head. Good retention & lacing. Nose of nectar, water melon jam, floral, spicy hop. Medium to full body. Sticky. Complex taste. Caramel, toffee, melon, nectar, notable medium grassy bitterness. Excellent balance. Long bittersweet finish. Great.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Butelka 500 ml. Ciemno rubinowy kolor. Ciemna herbata. O bialej lekko palonej sredniej pianie. Aromat karmelu i slodow lekko alkoholowy. Caly zapach bardzo nikly.Slodkawy posmak z alkoholowa nuta karmel cukry sliwki. Piwo niezle ale bardzo podobne do innych na rynku.  Marcin G

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Head quickly fades away. Deep bronze (black tea) color. Smells malt, caramel, alcohol, candy. There are some metal notes in the aroma (in bottled beer). Sweet and full body. Easy to drink, but you can feel alcohol.

Mooi rood-bruin bier. Wist niet wat ik hier van moest verwachten, behalve de goede rating op RB. Het is een heerlijk bier, niet heel uitgesproken van smaak, maar precies lekker: caramel, zoetig, hoppig, gedroogd fruit. Onverwacht lekker!

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2016 Its funny. For years Ive seen Golden Pride in UK supermarkets and Ive never got around to it because I presumed it was a bog standard golden ale. How wrong I was! Stunning looking clear red beer with a medium white foam head which dissipates to thin. Nose is also stunning. Candy sugar, barley sugar sweets, red fruit, cranberry, raspberry, fresh plum, sultanas, prune. Its up there with the top bottled Belgian ales. Wow! Taste is candy sugar, barley sugar, cherry, dry-ish hop, dry-ish yeast, big fruity, cranberry, dried fruit, something like cognac or whisky, orange citrous, bitter hop, toasted bready grains. Blown away that this is a pasteurised English ale and a supermarket beer. Superb.
Aroma e sabor intenso, bem frutado. Cor avermelhada e paladar perfeito com delicioso amargor em seu final.

0,5 bottle from alko. Dark copper colour, diminishing slightly tanned head, soft carbonation. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits and alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet, light bitterness. Full bodied is there ever was one. Finish is long.

0,5l bottle. Beutiful dark copper colour (just like the label shows on the bottle) with short and very quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: plum and raisin. Wine like. Taste: Very wine like. When it gets warmer some fruity notes comes in. Sweet/sour wine taste then a moderate bitterness. The alcohol is not enough hidden. Medium/full body and fizzy carbonation. A bit sour/sweet finish.
FTA: Finally found it. Had several pints during vacation in Italy. In an Irish pub. So keg option. Have not seen it since. Was more like a bock rather than strong ale. More malty and hoppy. Loved it.

Âmbar escura com boa formação de espuma densa e consistente. Predominância de malte tostado e torrado, madeira, caramelo e lúpulo floral. Corpo médio com final longo, levemente adocicado e com agradável amargor no retrogosto.
*Old rating. Best before 19 Jun 11. Great fruity smooth body. Smooth, hints of fruit, caramel, fruit. Round Ale-bitterness in the aftertaste. Round and great!
Bottle, 33 cl, The Queens Head, Stockholm. Overall decent ale, fruity still complex, malty aroma.
Flaske: Farven er dybrød. Aromaen er karamel, honning og tørret frugt, smagen er alkohol, malt og humle. God, gedigen øl.
Meget humle, let ovre i noget der minder om de amerikanske gumler selvom det nok ikke er det.

Aroma:

Malts, caramel, fruit, sweet.

Appearance:

Clear amber/orange beer with a small off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

 A beautiful sweet mix of malts and fruit enter your mouth, with a spicy dry finish.

Bottle. Slight fruity and sweet toffee aroma, dark amber colour, long-life medium-sized light beige head, medium body, soft carbonation, sweet malty and caramel taste, earthy and vibrant hoppy palate. Nice one!

Bottle. Slightly hazy amber with a small creamy head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, honey, dried fruits and alcohol. Pretty sweet with huge malty backbone, flavors of caramel, dried fruits, honey, bread, nuts, a bit bitter with dry-ish finish. Medium-bodied, very smooth and chewy mouthfeel. Boozy but decent. OK for slow sipping.

Bottle 330ml. Clear copper with medium off-white head. Aroma of toffee and caramel with some herbs and sweet raisin. Bittersweet flavor with notes of caramel, citrus, herbs and raisin, quite alcoholic, sticky bitter finish. Soft carbonation, medium-bodied. A bit alcoholic but nice.

Ambrée caramel, carbo tres faible, petit collet fin.
Caramel et fruits rouges mais assez leger en intensite.
Bien riche en bouche, ronde et fruite, un peu riche en sucre, des notes de pain, de toast. Bonne longueur sur alcool type cherry.
0.5 l bottle from Alko. Dark amber colour, almost no head. Taste has some bitterness, butterscotch, drid fruits. All in all a complicated balance between sweet and sour.

33cl bottle. @L´Artesana, La Felguera. 27-09-2015.
In short: robust malty ale.
Pours quite clear deep gold- light copper, with nice offwhite head. Short head retention, some lacing. Malty, caramel, fruity nose. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is quite sweet, fruity, malty, little toast and biscuits. Warm mouthfeel, alcohol noticed. English yeast characterfull. Well balanced, rounded. A quite strong malty ale.

Not a bad brew for 8.5% alc. Pours amber with slight head, not much carbonation. Medium to full body. Quite sweet with some bitter notes. 
Sweet caramel, with malts, and brown sugar, a hint of herbs, fruits, and overall a nice strong ale.

(Bottle) Clear amber brown with short-lived thin tan head. Pleasant but subtle aroma - toffee with some tangy fruity hints. Full bodied with good carbonation. Amazing, rich, complex taste. Rich sweet malt is the most prominent flavour with strong notes of molasses, toffee, raisins, dates with subtler notes emerging in the mid-palate of orange and spice, and some bite and bitterness in the finish. Very impressive beer.

Bottle. BB 04.2016. Pours a deep coppery amber with a good creamy head leaving some lace. Very nice malty, toasty, marmalady sweet aroma with a bit of red berry sourness, caramel, and a touch of alcohol coming through. Tastes sweeeet, I get jam and marmalade, toasty and nutty notes, as well as a touch of burnt caramel. Its mostly just malts - theres only a bit of finishing bitterness. Carbonation thin and not very active. Its a touch shy of a good barley wine - a bit too thin and lacking boldness. Its, lets say, a somewhat mellow and lean for that (with all due respect). Might improve with aging - will go ahead and try with another bottle. It is very good as it is though.
Pours clear, dark amber. Minimal head. Aroma is vinous, a little bit of caramel and alcohol too. Smooth, warming, nice carbonation. Taste is caramel, then herbal biterness. Nice!
Flowery and caramel aromas, alcohol hits the palate at first sip then sweet caramel taste comes with moderate hop bitterness.
Amber with a long lasting off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, pine, licorice, citrus and banana. Taste is sweet and mild bitter.

Cobrizo intenso con transparencia, buena espuma baja retención. Licoroso alto sin ser invasivo, presenta ligero metálico, fenólicos (vanilla), malta maltoso caramelo moderado, lúpulo herbal-terroso moderado bajo. En boca tibieza alcohólica alta, lúpulo terroso alto, amargor alto sin astringencia, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, ésteres a frutos secos y fenoles (vainilla y picor suave). Final maltoso y con amargo de lúpulo en balance sin astringencia, prolongado, gran cerveza.
From Carrefour. In english pint glass. Watching Breaking Bad 1x03. It smells nice, but although it doesnt taste bad, I dont completly like its taste, which is on the sweet side.

Sweet malt aroma and a taste that is close up to English barley wine. Vinous is a little pronounced, but it has great flavor shades of soft fruits together with malt, characterizes towards a barley. The large group of beer that British denotes strong ales can vary very much in their expression. Therefore, it is almost impossible to set a standard for what is kind of right for strong ales. Fuller has once again branded English ale in a good way with this Golden Pride. It is simply its own and can not be compared with other strong ales. With elegant soft rounded aftertaste where little hoppy bitterness is present to maintain the good taste of summer berries far in the aftertaste, it is a fine ale. I can not get it expressed often enough, but have to say that if Fullers logo is on the label, you can confidently put it in the basket. Fuller is the provider of good quality beer, and it applies to everything that is brewed from there.

Aroma: Medium-high dark fruit, prunes, Medium sweetness, marshmallows, Medium syrup
Appearance: Brilliant copper body. Small, cream head. Good retention, Lacing.

Bière qualifiée par son brasseur de « superior strength ale »  jaime ça !
Elle est faite avec du pale ale et cristal malts, notamment avec du Golden Promise, 
et en plus 4 houblons pour parfaire le goût : Northdown, Challenger, Goldings et 
Target.
Elle titre à 8,5 % abv.
Couleur roux foncé, acajou.
Clarté nette. Bulle fines en colonnes, très nombreuses.
Mousse beige bien constituée, qui devient un nappage fin mais joli.
Arômes de malt grillé, cognac, pointe de porto, cassonade.
1ère bouche douce, soyeuse, mais avec un fort caractère : malt grillé, épices fortes,
pointe de noix et noisette.
Arrière-bouche au malt cara, avec beaucoup dherbes des bois.
2ème très liquoreuse, avec beaucoup dépices.
Arrière-bouche longue, sans concession.
3ème beaucoup mieux intégrée, mais avec du caractère.
Arrière-bouche bien marquée malt/houblon, avec une pointe de fumée.
La longueur retrouve le cognac, pointe de genièvre, pain dépices, cookie.
La progression est exceptionnelle dans léquilibre, la texture, avec des nuances superbes.
Les jambes sont parfaitement lisses.
Lalcool est bien dosé, bien progressif. Il soutient manifestement cette bière.
La finale ne déçoit pas, en apportant un résumé de cette bière.
CONCLUSION : grand brassin de chez Fullers, qui sent la Tamise, et qui plus est le cognac,
ce qui nest pas pour nous déplaire Les bouches dentrée sont un peu trop marquées du sceau
du caractère pour permettre des cotes de très haut vol, mais on est dans la très belle classe.

As it warmed up to room temp, the favours of the malt seem to come together better and its a nice sipper. Caramel malt textures with some dried fruit flavours, finish is rich, short and balanced, not too bitter. Soft to flat carbonation. Good.
Típica cerveja inglesa. Maltada e com um amargor equilibrado. Deliciosa pedida dentro do estilo. Tem uma cor muito interessante.
Dry caramell. Not nice because the dry taste. Very nice looking with whysky color. Nice head and lace. Good carbonation and body. Ok beer.
Golden clear with big head. Caramel, muscy aroma. Malt, alcohol, candy. Malty hoppines in the aftertaste. Ok beer

Ruby at the top, light amber at the bottom; still, with no head at all; aroma of marmalade / Christmas cake; lots of stewed orangey fruit which was fairly muted at first, but became progressively pronounced and toothsome as the drink went on; reminded me of Bush Ambree in that sense; the alcohol isnt hidden - this is a warming brew; I had this on cask once at The Whale in Buckingham - it was pretty mind blowing in 1996 and is still excellent bottled in 2013.

Bottle from Sainsburys. It pours clear deep amber with a small off-white head. The nose is wood, toast, toffee, stewed orange, hot cross bun, raisin and date. The taste is sweet, toffee, raisin, toasted malt, wood, orange peel, earth, light spice, varnish and warming alcohol with a dry, earthy finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich, warming and good depth of flavour, yet remains rather drinkable. Good stuff.

When its poured in glass a dark orange beer with a stable and persistent creamy foam head is seen. The aroma has some floral and citric notes being prevalent some orange and coffee notes. When is tasted a full body thick can be felt with a bitter end.
Bottle. Pours clear amber to brown with thin quickly disappearing tan head. Aroma is malt, candy, hint of hops. Flavor is malt, candy, overripe fruits, alcohol, hint of hops.

Pours a medium brown/caramel colour with some head. Aroma is sweet and hints of caramel. Body is sweeter but well balanced. Aftertaste is hoppy, floral and somewhat dry but the taste lingers for a while. In general a very drinkable strong ale.

Flaske delt med Ovesen på Holmens aktivtetsdag en strålende vakker oktobersøndag: dette er godsaker! Aroma og smak i retning av eksklusiv engelsk appelsinmarmelade. Elegant og balansert som de fleste fra Fuller. Refined and understated.

Bottle poured into tulip glass. Pours a beautiful amber colour, with a white-cream head, some lacing. Aroma is sweet biscuits, and the inside of a sauna (not the sweat!). Tastes roasty, toasty, slightly spicy. Mouthfeel is very full, alcoholic burn towards the end. Not for me, but its a nice beer.
Strong and balanced. I could taste some bread. The carbonation is soft and the finish is abrupt and dry.

Bronze coloured ale with small head. Caramel malts, some bitter cherry and some toffee sweetness. Caramel, toffee, some ripe fruits and mainly sweet flavors. Some bitterness at the end. Rich texture and enjoyable Strong Ale.
Cerveza de alta graduación pero de sabor agradable, ligeros toques de caramelo en nariz, muy rica

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a clear dark amber colour with a thin broken white head. The aroma is rich caramel and roasted malt. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a super liqourice nutty caramel palate. Super smooth and very tasty.

50cl bottle from bier and zo
Thick white head. Clear amber pour. Lots of caramel. Very nice
Sweet malty, caramel, raisins, nice fruitiness. Decent but not too noticeable hops. Bittersweet finish. Bit alcoholic, but not very pushy. Very nice brew

Pours a dark amber with a thin white head. Sweet toffee aroma. Medium body. Mild fine, foamy carbonation. The booze is a touch heavy, and its too sweet for me, but its also pretty damn tasty. Nuts, toffee, cake, mild citrus, rich, malt loaf, well balanced... Decent.
0.5l bottle. Deep amber appearance, Rich roasted malty aroma and caramel, moderately hopped. Medium head.Full body. long finish.Very well balanced.

Bottle. Poor foam. Clean amber colour. Sweet caramel, herbal, some spiciness and bit of diacetyl in aroma. Sweet malty toasty body, with interference spicy flavour. Moderate bitterness and sweetness in aftertaste. Poor carbonation. That bottle wasnt quite, what I expected. :(

500ml bottle BB March 2014. Pours a clear amber orange/brown. Initial head dies down after a matter of seconds. Smell is classic old ale, yeasty with some pungent caramel. Body is medium and slightly foamy. Taste has more caramel, spice, raisin. Quite sweet. Slightly drying finish. Not quite to my taste, but it seems a well made beer. A sipper.

Clear copper orange beer with a creamy head disappearing quite quickly. The aroma is caramelly malty with some alcohol. The flavor is mostly caramelly malty sweet with the alcohol coming through. Theres a little amount of bitterness. The palate is sticky and pretty full. I would have expected something more refined or complex from this beer, now its just mostly alcoholic.
Pours a deep amber with off white head. Malt raisins plums and caramel with some bitterness also. Overall a very good beer. Had the cask version also.
Quite nice with a mix of caramel, roasted malts and some modest hops. A bit too sweet for my taste though.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2013 500 ml bottle poured into a Pint glass
Appearance....... amber/copper beer with head colour white of almost 2 fingers
Aroma...............malt, alcohol, caramel, hops. Fresh and strong smell with a touch of malty aroma
Taste........ fenolic with a sweet malty touch, bitterness appears soon lasting all the time, with a dry finish 
Mouthfeel........... medium/full body and medium/soft carbonation
Overall............ a very nice strong ale, bitterness is present but in a perfect combination with malt and alcohol. One of my favourites, definitely a great English ale in his section (strongs ales) .

Appearance: Clear copper/amber, with a short lived ivory head.
Aroma: Liquorice, fruit cake/malt loaf, dried fig, biscuity, orange marmalade, slightly spicy, golden syrup, hint of yogurt and slight cognac.
Taste: Low/medium sweetness, medium/high bitterness, low/medium sourness, liquorice, treacle and fruit cake.
Palate: Medium body with full mouthfeel, smooth texture, medium/high carbonation, quick dry bitter finish with alcohol warmth towards the end.
Comments: Lovely, rich and delicious. No glass lace.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Op het eerste gezicht veel koolzuur. Weinig geur. Nootjes geur.
Lichte alcohol branding in buik. Nootjes smaak. Alcohol brand niet in de mond maar wel in je buik. Niet lekker. Niks bijzonders.

Helaas kan ik niet meer noteren als deze rating. Dit komt doordat ik dit biertje te slecht vond om er meer over te kunnen noteren.

0,5 l bottle, from Auchan.

Clear cooper liquid with a long creamy beige head.

Aroma has notes of malt, elder flowers, dried figs, raisins, linden flowers honey, dried banana, butter biscuits.

Full body, bittersweet taste, oily texture, average carbonation, bitter finish, long aftertaste. Very well balanced.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours deep golden with very low white head (almost none). Aroma is of caramel, fruits, sugar, malt. Taste is of malt, caramel, fruits, some bitterness, alcohol. Palate: Medium body. Sticky. Overall: Pretty good. Nice malt features. Warming. Good hopping, interesting balance.

Caramel and fruity aroma, some toasty notes? just a little bit of alcohol; Amber, rather clear, big and strong off-white foam; Medium sweet, medium bitterness; creamy feel, full body, average(+) carbonation, long bittersweet finish;
Overall: very good, strong but quite drinkable, tasty, great aroma

0.33l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. This is a dark amber-red colored beer with a small islandy and sidesticking head. Nice aroma, some sugary canned fruit mix, a little bit of butter, some oxidation also. It had a nice oily mouthfeel witch a small prickling carbonation level. It has some oxidation in the taste also, even if the bottle is not that old its still noticeable. Some red fruity sweet thing here, a dark malty flavor that I really like. Its really integrated and hard to tear apart. A fine one! 08.06.2013

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 08.06.2013, 0,33l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Small shortlasting head. Aroma is lots of caramel malts, dried fruits, nuts, toffee, grass. Taste is sweet, caramel malts, toffee, nuts, chocolate, grass. Medium bitterness. Not my favorite style.

500 ml bottle. 356. BB 21/Jun/14. (Alko) Kuopio, Finland.
Clear darkish red colour with a small off-white head. Fruity sweet hops, sweet malt, dark fruits and mild spices in the aroma. The flavour is hops, mild bitterness, dry fruits, sugary sweetness and sweetish malt. Rich.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a splendid golden amber colour, rocky, white, medium lasting head. Aroma has malt, caramel, bread, fruit and wood notes, with a moderate pleasant alcohol presence. Moderately sweet, dry finish. Little to medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Good warming beer.
Bottle, rated from backlog. Dark orange with beige head. Aroma sweet, malty, sugars, syrup, fruit and honey. Taste is sweet and malty; fruit, sugar, caramel and syrup. Nice!
Pale brown colour. Aroma is floral, sweet, fruity. Flavour is rich and fruity (sweet, dried fruits). Has a touch of warming alcolhol.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 Bottle @ home.  Poured dark amber/caramel colour with an off-white head.  Strong malty caramel overtones in the flavour.  Not overly hoppy. Underlying warmth from the alcohol.  A satisfying experience

Bottle. Pours clear amber with small white head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel. Sweet flavour of malt and caramel with subtle touches of raisins. Warming alcohol presence. Slightly rough aftertaste. Nice.

500ml bottle.  Pours  dark amber with bobbly head that quickly settles.  aroma with caramel and hops.  taste is fruity and soft with herbal and honey tones.   aftertaste is bitter with some alcohol heat. a decent ale.
Surprisingly good beer. Wasnt expecting it to be so good as it is mass produced but it was. Strongly bitter but well balanced, complex flavor and pleasant alcohol flavor. Good beer.

I quite like this ale, it is decidedly strong in alcohol, but actually doesnt taste to full of alcohol, a definite grown up persons bitter, with a definite bitter aftertaste, so more for the serious bitter lover I feel, it reminds me of the smell of proper old boozers in the north, heavy malty hop smell and flavour, I like!

Bottle at Fiddler.  Pours clear amber with an off white head.  Aroma of red fruit, caramel, candy, butterscotch, sweet malt.  Flavour is over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

9/IV/13 - 500ml bottle from Mitra van Bergen (Eindhoven, NL) @ home - BB: 7/II/14 (2013-318)  
Clear deep orange to amber beer, big fizzy light beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very sweet, malty, sugar, red fruits syrup, bubble gum, honey. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet malty start, red fruit jam, sugary, some citrus, bitter hops, strawberry jam. Aftertaste: caramel, sweet malts, honey, red fruit jam, little bitter, some toast. I liked this beer a lot, my fellow tasting buddies did not.

Bottle. Pours a clear copper colour with a shortlived white head. Aroma of malt, hops and spring. Taste is of malt, hops, sugar, caramel and sweet fruits, but has a bitter hoppy aftertaste with lots of alcohol in it. Medium body.
Alcohol aroma ruins the pleasant notes. Dark copper beautiful colour. Thin head. Light sweetness and very soft. Medium body sweetish finish.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with a nice head. Aroma is sweet fruity, malty, caramel alcool can be felt. Flavour is sweet, some apple, very strong with some bitterness. Alchool is a bit to strong
Solid British ale, quite fruity aroma, some similarities with brandy in taste.

500 ml bottle, poured into an english pint glass. ABV 8.5%
Its only 4 o clock and I hadnt noticed the alcohol when I grabbed the bottle. Too bored to go downstairs again and pick up a lighter beer, I decided to open it. Deep orange/red colour on the body, two fingers of lightly beige head, with average retention. No lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of fruits. Apricots, grapes. Sugars too.
Taste follows the aroma, but very sweet. Lots of sugar, malts, the alcohol notable and then lots of fruity notes. 
Medium on the body, light carbonation.
Overall, good ale, but a bit on the sweet side for me.
0,5l bottle. Red color. Aroma is caramel, toffee and some fruits. Taste is hops, toffee, caramel and fruits. It has slightly alcohol note. Medium bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 reddish-amber colour; creamy off-white head; aroma of honey, malts, sweet driecd fruits, maybe herbs; taste of honey, malty sweetness,dried fruits,  spices, alcohol and some bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Red amber beer with small head that disapears. Aroma is malts. Taste is sweet malts, madeira, hops and alcohol. This slightly oily and medium bodied. A nice beer which is balanced well enough. The alcohol does come through though in the taste. I like a little more subtlety. Otherwise very decent.

Strong dark amber ale, aromas of toffee and malt. Taste is malty, sweet caramel, butterscotch and honey. There is a malty, bitter aftertaste. Some really nice flavours jump out at you with this one as it warms. This is a good strong English ale.

50 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20090116.
Pours copper color with a medium sized head. Aroma of caramel, toffee hints, fruits and hay. Flavor of caramel malts, mild hops, fruits, some hay and faint toffee. Very nicely balanced brew.

Aroma has English hops, some toffee, hay and caramel. Flavour is sweetish with English hops, nettles, hay, some toffee, caramel and distant floral notes. Feels a bit messy, not my kind of beer.

Bottle at home, from Waitrose Sunningdale, 16/02/13.
Pours an almost clear dark golden with a thin white head that vamooshes edgeward allied to evidence of carbonation in the form of bubbles.
Nose carries caramel, candle wax, sweet sugars, berry fruits, touch of wood, honey.
Taste comprises sweet sugars, rich caramel notes, dark ripe orange, citrus tones, touch of booze.
Medium bodied with bite, moderate carbonation, dryish sweet finish. Carbonation flattens and improves over time.
Ok but to be honest Id rather drink standard pride any day ! Have had this on cask in the past and seem to remember it being better than this ! Need to revisit said version! Came across more so as a barley wine to me in terms of style!
